Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

Chronicles of House Ny'dar - Personal Log Entry 4197-01.5/1 - The universe was created with two kinds of creatures in mind: The ones that rule and the ones that serve. For generations, the Syndicate houses were the ones to rule, until the emperors grew envious of our wealth and robbed us of our heritage. Now, with the Star Union gone, a new age of Syndicate hegemony is at its dawn. Our associates may not always find our offers appealing, but they rarely complain – not successfully anyway.
Spoken by Shae Mara; added for context

Chronicles of House Ny'dar - Personal Log Entry 4197-01.5/2 - Since the passing of my brother in an unfortunate accident, it has become my duty and privilege to lead House Ny'dar through these eventful times. There are rumors of House Timur falling from grace, leaving a vacancy in the Ruling Seven that many will intend to fill.
Spoken by Shae Mara; added for context

Chronicles of House Ny'dar - Personal Log Entry 4197-01.5/3 - Over the course of the past few weeks, our Hackers have tapped into the communication relays of our fiercest competitors, sending some rather volatile, falsified diplomatic messages in their names. That should keep them busy fighting amongst each other for a while. Time that we need to draw up our plans.
Spoken by Shae Mara; added for context

Chronicles of House Ny'dar - Personal Log Entry 4197-01.5/4 - An old associate of mine, Zul Nadjian, has contacted me. He claims to have found a source of power that will assure House Ny'dar's place in the Ruling Seven. It is an ancient secret sealed away on a planet whose entire records have been wiped from the old Imperial Archives. Zul has proven to be a reliable source in the past, so I have decided to personally take care of this matter.
Spoken by Shae Mara; added for context

Chronicles of House Ny'dar - Personal Log Entry 4197-02.1/1 - The unnamed planet lies before us, its surface still shrouded by atmospheric clouds. My instincts tell me that Zul was right and House Ny’dar’s future fortune is buried somewhere down there. It is only a matter of finding the right shovel to dig it up.
Spoken by Shae Mara; added for context
Go to the location of the device
Short objective description. The device is intentionally nondescript
Short objective description. Name of a location.
Short objective description. Name of a location.
Short objective description. Name of a location.
Short objective description. Adam McKinley is a male Vanguard Commander
Short objective description. Dali Ardelli is a male Syndicate Commander
Short objective description. Pillar of Light is a structure built in your colonies
Defeat Adam McKinley and Dali Ardelli
Short objective description. See lines 11 and 12.
Structure name. Daemon are computer programs, used in the game as buffs and debuffs, please translate consistently.
A Daemon Conversion Plant to enable the ancient Daemon to be interfaced and integrated into a Personality Daemon.
Structure Name. A structure to be produced in your colonies
The blueprint is soggy and torn in places, the design is raising the eyebrows of all your engineers and the ship is 90% scrap. What can go wrong?
Azer Starg tells you that rising this huge monument will clear the atmospheric disturbance long enough for you to escape.
Structure Description. Azer Starg is an Assembly Commander
Sector Name. Voidum can be translated as <VoidInYourLanguage>-um
Take control and annex the structures pinpointed by Zul and find the location of the Device.[br/][br/]Device found: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
You found the structure, now annex the lost Synthesis Facility to study its contents.[br/][br/]Synthesis Facility Annexed: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
Victory Condition Description. Synthesis is a secret tech, please translate consistently
Find a way to transfer Zul's Personality Daemon into the ancient Avatar you found in the lost Synthesis Facility.[br/][br/]Avatar activated: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
Victory Condition Description. Zul is a male Syndicate Hero unit. Avatar is a robotic Synthesis unit.
Victory Condition: Escape from the Prison Planet
Adam tells you that Dali Ardelli is the one behind the atmospheric disturbance, and asks you to defeat them alongside them.
Victory condition Description. Adam and Dali are commanders, see entry 11 and 12 for reference.
Dali owns the structure that is causing the atmospheric disturbance but can't deactivate it without codes that the Vanguard Commander has memorized, defeat them and extract the code from Adam.
Victory condition Description. Adam and Dali are commanders, see entry 11 and 12 for reference.
The Assembly proposed you build a Pillar of Light in one of your colonies to temporarily clear the anomaly.
Victory condition Description. Assembly are an in-game race
Adam and Dali each hold half the key to break free from the planet, the fools trapped each other for who knows how many years. Defeat them!
Victory condition Description. Adam and Dali are commanders, see entry 11 and 12 for reference.

Capture an Imperial Energy Complex to boost your scanners and locate the device your associate Zul Nadjian spoke of.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: You don't need to claim the Imperial Energy Complex revealed by Zul. Capturing any similar structure will be enough to complete this quest.)[/recommendedcol]
Quest Description. Zul Nadjian is a male Syndicate Hero.
Move your troops to the supposed location of the device and investigate.
Clear Rift Bridge of its inhabitants to allow Adam to retrieve the blueprints inside.
Quest Description. Rift Bridge is a location name, Adam is a male Vanguard Commander
Retrieve the Screaming Stone for Dali Ardelli by clearing the Dark Voidum Temple.
Quest Description. Dali is a male Syndicate Commander, Dark Voidum Temple is a location name
Quest Name. Lost Synthesis Network is the name of a facility (location)
Take control of the Lost Synthesis Facility and annex it, in order to retrieve and study whatever is hidden inside.
We could transfer Zul's Daemon with a large amount of energy to ensure the transfer is done correctly.
We could transfer Zul's Daemon with a Conversion Plant that lets us interact with the device.
Defeat the Vanguard and recover the codes so you and the other House may leave the planet.
Quest Description. The Vanguard are an in-game race
Defeat the Syndicate to find the facility causing the atmospheric disruption.
Defeat the Syndicate and the Vanguard
Defeat Dali to possess the Disruption Matrix and Adam to retrieve the codes to safely deactivate it.
Quest Description. Disruption Matrix is an item.
Retrieve scrap from the pile indicated by the Spacers
Quest Description. The Spacers are an in-game faction
Deliver the Scrap to the indicated Spacer Dwelling
Build the Scrap Spacecraft in one of your colonies.
Build a Pillar of Light and work with Azer Starg so you may escape from the planet.
You managed to escape with what you were looking for.

We have finally landed, but we’ve sustained some structural damage. There is an incredible amount of atmospheric disturbance on this planet - leaving again won’t be easy. Regardless, that is a concern for later. Zul, what are the coordinates of the device?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Patience, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. It’s proving difficult to pinpoint our target through the volatile atmosphere. We could boost our scanners by discharging the energy reserves of an old Imperial Energy Complex. I have detected one close to our current position.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate male)

Oh, and one more thing: the planet’s climate is unusually active, quickly shifting between Arid and Arctic. We’ve noticed patterns of rapid erosion in the soil, so although it’s warm and dry now, it may freeze later. Keep that in mind when you set up your colonies.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate male)
Go to the Vanguard settlement and acquire its inhabitants as property of House Ny'dar by using your influence or military power.
Quest Description. Influence is an in-game currency
Hey! Is anybody out there? We’ve been stuck on this deathtrap of a planet for what seems like an eternity… Our supplies are running short. There is barely anyone left of our unit. We need help!
Story Piece. Speaker: Vanguard Refugees (mixed gender group)

A Vanguard settlement lost in the desert? How very unfortunate... Surely, they will appreciate it when someone competent provides for them in their misery. They may not be Syndicate, but their military nature, accustomed to drills and obedience, will make those Vanguard a passable addition to the plebs managed by our Overseers.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Preparing to discharge energy reserves in three… two… one…[br/][br/]The sensor sweep got through the planetary interference. We have a signature matching the scanner profile of the device. Its location has been uploaded to our maps.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate male)
Bravo-05, come in Bravo-05... damnit! Wait, there’s someone else on this line. Blast it, another Syndicate! As if we didn’t already have enough trouble with the accursed Ardelli!
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)
Not a very good diplomat, are we, Commander? What if that ‘other’ Syndicate house has gracefully shown up to offer you a way out of your miserable situation?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

You can’t trick me with words. How could you even understand the predicament I am in when you’ve just arrived on this prison of a planet? No, I demand action! Bring me the central stability projector from the Voidtech Complex not far from here. Then we can talk!
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)

I’ve got the stability projector you asked for, McKinley. Now, you mentioned something about this planet being a prison? Elaborate, or I’m afraid House Ny’dar will have to find another buyer for the item.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

I knew it! You Syndicate never do anything without a price. Very well, since it seems Vanguard Central Command abandoned us decades ago, I may as well tell you: this planet was designed as a high-security cell for a single prisoner.
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)

We do not know anything about the prisoner’s identity, only that the entire assignment required the highest level of secrecy. Empress Carminia herself signed our orders. The prisoner must be long dead, but if you want to search his remains, I can give you the coordinates of the prison complex where he was held.
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male). Empress Carminia is a female ancient emperor.

A criminal dangerous enough to require a planet as his cell? An intriguing story indeed. Throw in some energy for the handling fee, and you can have that stability projector of yours.[br/][br/]Certainly, it was a pleasure doing business with you.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Well this is new, a fellow house leader on an isolated world.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male)
I recognize these colors. I did not know the Ardelli travelled so far. Shouldn’t you be busy licking your brother’s boots back on Raliton Beta?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.). Raliton Beta is a planet name.

That would be my second brother, Aron. It gives me certain satisfaction to know he still has to linger in Givori’s shadow. But for the future, let it be clear that I am the only one allowed to insult any members of House Ardelli. Guard your tongue!
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Givori and Aron are both Dali's brothers.
The third Ardelli brother? The hot head running away on a Hoverbike? Now that’s some interesting plot twist![br/][br/]I visited your funeral last spring. It was quite a touching ceremony.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.) Hoverbike is a Syndicate vehicle.

I had a feeling my family would make sure I could only return as an imposter. Not that it mattered though. Unlike my brothers, my sole interest in Psynumbra had always been to harness its melodies. The last years on this rock have provided me with the perfect environment to bring my grim compositions to perfection.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male)

Once I’ve gotten my hands on the Screaming Stone, I will be able to directly share the songs from the Abyss with my fans. My brother may still have the power, but I will have the fame.[br/][br/]The Screaming Stone lies guarded within a Psynumbra Sanctorum. Recover it and I’ll make sure to promote you on my first concert tour.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Screaming Stone is a quest item.
Oh, yes! I can already hear the masses chanting the chorus of Oblivion. You have my gratitude. I’ll make sure House Ny’dar will play its part in one of my future ballads.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

A touching gesture, but hardly profitable enough. I propose a twenty percent profit share from your first album including an immediate loan to insure me against failure. That or the Screaming Stone remains in my possession.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Ha, very well! I’ll give you fifteen. Now, if you don’t mind, I’ll be off for some additional recordings. The Vanguard on this planet have proven to provide some excellent sound samples when conducted by my Malictors...
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Malictors are Psynumbra units.

This pyramid complex… I don’t need any scanner readings to confirm to me that this is the reason we’ve come to this planet.[br/][br/]The vector lights projected around the main compound remind me of our own Synthesis technology. Things are starting to get interesting.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

So, the device we’ve been after is an old Union era Avatar model. Intriguing. Though simple from the outside, our technology couldn’t even interlink with its core functions, as if something is denying us access. We only got a glimpse at its vast database and at what appear to be the stored recollections of a previous user.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.) Union era as in the time where the Star Union was ruling. Avatar is a digital Syndicate unit.

We could transfer a Personality Daemon into the Avatar to activate it, but its software structure is quite different from the models we’re using. We will need to build a conversion module to study the Avatar further until we can perform the Daemon transfer – or we could force the integration of the Personality Daemon by overcharging the Avatar’s security matrix.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.). Personality Daemon is a computer program that can be uploaded (holding a personality)
Regardless, I have to decide whose Personality Daemon to use. I wonder… who is the most loyal servant of House Ny’dar?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

It would be a great honor for me to undergo the uploading process once the transfer is ready. I wish to see the world through the Avatar’s eyes. My mortal body will be useless, but I will have the infinity of cyber space to explore.[br/][br/]All in service of House Ny'dar, of course.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate male)

Regardless, I have to decide whose Personality Daemon to use. I wonder… who is the most loyal servant of House Ny’dar?[br/][br/]Bring me Zul’s Personality Daemon. Right now, he seems like the best candidate for the transfer. He has proven his loyalty in the past and was the one to lead us to the Avatar in the first place.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Of course. As a reward for your dedication and loyalty I shall accept your proposal. I’d advise you to start with the necessary preparations in time. We have no margin for additional delays.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

So, you’ve managed to retrieve the ancient Avatar. I am impressed. Don’t look so surprised. I may have come to this planet for other reasons, but I am still an Ardelli. We have our ways of knowing things. The Psynumbra has refined our instincts.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male)

Harnessing the power from the Abyss could suit you equally well, {STR_LeaderName}. All you need to do is to attune to these Psi-Stones and use them as a medium to induce the Daemon transfer. This is where your journey to Psynumbra can begin.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Pis-stones are Psionic weaponry. Psynumbra is an in-game secret tech. The Abyss is a Psynumbra term, please translate consistently

Studying the Psynumbra is a tempting opportunity. I will take the Psi-Stones and will consider their usage as a possible solution to our problem. House Ny’dar sends you its regards for this generous gift.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Though a tempting offer, I’m afraid I’ll have to decline. Allowing your psionic artifacts in the halls of my House seems like an unnecessary risk.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Learn to attune to the Psi-Stones gifted to you by Dali Ardelli to use them as a medium for the transfer of Zul's Personality Daemon into the ancient Avatar.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: Completing this quest will make you adopt Psynumbra as a Secret Technology for the next mission!)[/firecol]
Activates the psionic potential of the medium.
Bring me Zul's Personality Daemon, he shall be used for this.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

(Zul's Daemon node deactivates and the ancient Avatar starts to spring to life.)[br/][br/]I’ve never felt so... vast... so powerful... This vessel, it is something incredible. The knowledge stored inside is overwhelming.
Story Piece. Speaker: Third-person Narrator in brackets, Zul Nadjian afterward
Good to hear you are making yourself comfortable in your new home. Did the transfer damage your Personality Daemon?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

I do not know how to answer that. I seem to be in control of all my mental faculties, however there is something else. The name Ara’rael comes to my mind quite often. It is strange, but no reason for concern. Give me a moment. I need to adjust myself to this new existence.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Is now a Synthesis Avatar Unit)

(The Avatar turns dim for a second, then immediately lights up again.)[br/][br/]I know a way off the planet. The instability binding us here is artificial. The Syndicate and the Vanguard each hold half of the key to our freedom, and in their infighting, they have been keeping each other chained and unable to escape.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Is now a Synthesis Avatar Unit)
Is that so? Send a system-wide alert. We are going to launch a full-scale assault against the two fools.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

If you are intrigued by this power, help me escape from this planet and I shall teach you so much more. The Harmony Beyond welcomes everyone. But to get off the planet we will need the clearance codes Adam McKinley holds.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Harmony Beyond is a Psynumbra term for 'heaven', please translate consistently.

If you are intrigued by this power, help me escape from this planet and I shall teach you so much more. The Harmony Beyond welcomes everyone. But to get off the planet we will need to use the clearance codes Adam McKinley held.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male). Harmony Beyond is a Psynumbra term for 'heaven', please translate consistently.
Clearance codes? What are you talking about?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

The atmospheric anomaly holding everyone on this planet a prisoner is created by an imperial distortion matrix. I already got control of the matrix, but without the proper clearance codes it cannot be shut down. Adam McKinley is offering violent resistance with his Vanguard, but together we should be able to extort the codes from him.
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male).

The atmospheric anomaly holding everyone on this planet a prisoner is created by an imperial distortion matrix. I already got control of the matrix, but without the proper clearance codes it previously couldn't be shut down. What do you say, {STR_LeaderName}, you wanna go on that hell ride together?
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male).
Very well, let us deal with the Vanguard and leave this planet together.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Very well, with the Vanguard rotting to dust I see no reason to extend House Ny'dar's business on this planet. Let us leave.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Not only do I control the ancient Avatar, I also know how to get rid of the planetary disturbance. Goodbye, Dali Ardelli. You have been of great use to my house. Now you and the Vanguard can be left to rot on this planet.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

{STR_LeaderName}, now that you have retrieved the Avatar from the Synthesis Facility my mission on this planet has lost its last meaning. I desire nothing more than to finally leave this accursed rock.
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)

The atmospheric distortions were created as part of the planet’s security system. I still hold the clearance codes to deactivate the imperial distortion matrix that is causing them, but since Dali Ardelli captured the facility, we have become prisoners on our own. We need your help, {STR_LeaderName}. Ardelli may be sharp, but against our combined forces, he won’t stand a chance.
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)

The atmospheric distortions were created as part of the planet’s security system. I still hold the clearance codes to deactivate the imperial distortion matrix that is causing them, but after Dali Ardelli captured the facility, we had become prisoners on our own. Now that Ardelli is dead, will you continue our cooperation and leave this planet together?
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male)
The other Syndicate houses don’t need to learn about what happened here. Silencing Ardelli can only benefit us. Let us both prepare for the assault.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
The other Syndicate houses don’t need to learn about what happened here. You helped us to silence Ardelli. House Ny'dar will return the favor.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Placing the fate of my house in the hands of a Vanguard Commander? What a disgusting thought! Goodbye, Adam McKinley. You have been of great help, but there comes a time when every Syndicate house needs to dispose of its expended assets.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Good move, betraying the Vanguard. Now that we know how to remove the planetary disturbance, we can take out both him and Ardelli to escape on our own.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Is now a Synthesis Avatar Unit)
Good move, betraying the Vanguard. Now that we know how to remove the planetary disturbance, we can take out Adam McKinley to escape on our own.
Never mess with a superior house!
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Welcome to my humble establishment, Adam McKinley. I have been waiting for this moment. Now, master of House Ny’dar, let me show you how to properly ‘extract’ those clearance codes. It won’t take very long...
Story Piece. Speaker: Dali Ardelli (Syndicate male).
A crippling assault. Here, take the blasted codes and use them to disable the imperial disruption matrix.[br/][br/]There is a special place in the Void for people like you, Dali Ardelli.
Story Piece. Speaker: Adam McKinley (Vanguard male). Void is a Voidtech term, please translate consistently

Huh? Never seen you around here before. Spacers is our clan, and we're the free people of this land. We need to travel to the Sacred Junkyard to gather new props. But we've got a big guild raid happening soon, so we’re busy. Go meet the Azer Starg, leader of the living effigies, and ask him for these specific parts.
Story Piece. Speaker: Spacer Preacher (male). Azer Starg is an Assembly Male Commander
I am receiving it now, they gave us the location of some... pile of scrap? Along with a wish list of different scrap pieces.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Synthesis Male)

Amusing. We might as well see where this is going. These Spacers seem primitive enough to be easily manipulated. I could certainly see the benefit in them riding their barbaric constructs into battle for House Ny’dar.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
What a pleasant surprise! Allow me to welcome your house to our meditation grounds. I am Azer Starg.
Story Piece. Speaker: Azer Starg (Assembly male)
What is it with all of this junk? I thought the Spacers were the only ones playing in scrap.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

The metal serves another purpose, light of the Celestian willing. I have told the Spacers many times they are welcome to take anything we do not use, but they think we are some form of sentient ‘effigies’. Would you please take the scrap that they want and give it to them? They are building a space ship to take off to the stars.
Story Piece. Speaker: Azer Starg (Assembly male). Celestian is a secret tech.
The Spacers are going to attempt to fly through this atmosphere? That might actually be entertaining to watch… I will see what we can do, but I cannot make any promises.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Here you are. Apparently, you wanted all this scrap for spaceship parts?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

To the skies... and it ain't scrap!! The guy I replaced five minutes ago said the meat tastes better up there. Now give us the divine parts![br/][br/]Actually, we have no idea how to build a spaceship. Could you assemble it? Please?
Story Piece. Speaker: Spacer Preacher (male). Azer Starg is an Assembly Male Commander
What do you mean you can't assemble it!? You are the ones who wanted the parts!
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Well, we obviously can't touch the sacred scrap, coz' it's sacred! Here, these are the blueprints. Do this for us and we will give you our second best scrap![br/][br/]Sheesh, not very smart this one.
Story Piece. Speaker: Spacer Preacher (male). Azer Starg is an Assembly Male Commander
I don't have time for this nonsense! House Ny’dar has higher priorities, more important business to deal with.[br/][br/]They've stopped listening...
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

Well, it is done. We followed the crude blueprints of the Spacers as far as there was anything to follow, but my engineering advisors say that the best this thing can do is serve as a bloated firework.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Marvelous, this is just how I imagined it! Well, Droopy drew it first and then I imagined it. Here, your reward.[br/][br/](Something drops out of the vehicle onto the ground)
Story Piece. Speaker: Spacer Preacher (male). Azer Starg is an Assembly Male Commander. Droopy is a Spacers grunt
I have no idea what they are going to do with it, but let us finally be done with this circus.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

My friend, I don't like seeing you like this. Perhaps the time for change has come. If you do not wish to destroy those who oppose you, join me in building a Pillar of Light. If we both work together, you may escape without unnecessary bloodshed.
Story Piece. Speaker: Azer Starg (Assembly male). Pillar of Light is a holy structure to be built
My database contains knowledge of the ancient Celestian arts, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. What Azer Starg is saying may be more likely to work than it sounds.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Synthesis Avatar Unit)
I know it may be too late to resolve this conflict peacefully, but if we endure while constructing the Pillars you can still escape.[br/][br/]What say you? Will you accept a defensive alliance?
Story Piece. Speaker: Azer Starg (Assembly male). Pillar of Light is a holy structure to be built
Not having to bother with those fighting fools could certainly save us some time. The longer they will be busy with each other, the better. We will try it your way, Azer Starg.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
The only blood that needs not be shed is the blood of House Ny’dar’s loyal servants. Just watch as I make sure those fools are getting what they deserve.
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Look, the sky is clearing just above us.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Synthesis Avatar Unit)
Faithful, we will race you to the stars! Droopy, open your eye folds! The moment is here! Let's go![br/][br/](Even you are amazed that the pile of scrap you built for them can actually fly.)
Story Piece. Speaker: Spacer Preacher (male). Droopy is a Spacers grunt
Story Piece. Speaker: Azer Starg (Assembly male).
Incompetents! It is clear now that House Ny’dar should resolve this relying on its own strength alone. Let there be no one left to stand in my way!
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

With the entire planet under House Ny’dar’s control, finding the device we’ve been after was only a formality. It is an old Union era Avatar model. So far, we’ve only had a glimpse at its vast database and will need to transfer a Personality Daemon to activate it. I wonder… who is the most loyal servant of House Ny’dar?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

It would be a great honor for me to undergo the uploading process. I wish to see the world through the Avatar’s eyes. My mortal body will be useless, but I will have the infinity of cyber space to explore.[br/][br/]All in service of House Ny'dar, of course.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate Male)

Bring me Zul’s Personality Daemon. Right now, he seems like the best candidate for the transfer. He has proven his loyalty in the past and was the one to lead us to the Avatar in the first place. Prepare for the transfer to begin. Starting in three… two… one…
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
Of course. As a reward for your dedication and loyalty I shall accept your proposal. Prepare for the neural upload to begin. Starting in three… two… one…
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

(Zul's Daemon node deactivates and the ancient Avatar starts to spring to life.)[br/][br/]I’ve never felt so... vast... so powerful... This vessel, it is something incredible. The knowledge stored inside is overwhelming.
Story Piece. Speaker: Third-person Narrator in brackets, Zul Nadjian afterward

(The Avatar turns dim for a second, then immediately lights up again.)[br/][br/]I know a way off the planet. The instability binding us here is artificial. The Syndicate and the Vanguard each held half of the key to our freedom, but as they are both dead, we can just combine their two pieces and leave.
Story Piece. Speaker: Third-person Narrator in brackets, Zul Nadjian afterward

Excellent. No unfinished business, no eyewitnesses left – this is what I call a successful enterprise. Take us out, Zul! Afterwards, we can discuss the utility of your new existence for House Ny’dar’s future...
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

With the entire planet under House Ny’dar’s control, gathering the required resources to initiate the Personality Daemon transfer was only a formality. Zul, prepare for the neural upload to begin. Starting in three… two… one…
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

(Zul's Daemon node deactivates and the ancient Avatar starts to spring to life.)[br/][br/]I’ve never felt so... vast... so powerful... This vessel, it is something incredible. The knowledge stored inside is overwhelming.
Story Piece. Speaker: Third-person Narrator in brackets, Zul Nadjian afterward
Good to hear you are making yourself comfortable in your new home. Did the transfer damage your Personality Daemon?
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)

I do not know how to answer that. I seem to be in control of all my mental faculties, however there is something else. The name Ara’rael comes to my mind quite often. It is strange, but no reason for concern. Give me a moment. I need to adjust myself to this new existence.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Synthesis Avatar Unit)

(The Avatar turns dim for a second, then immediately lights up again.)[br/][br/]I know a way off the planet. The instability binding us here is artificial. The Syndicate and the Vanguard each held half of the key to our freedom, but as they are both dead, we can just combine their two pieces and leave.
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Synthesis Avatar Unit)
Excellent. No unfinished business, no eyewitnesses left – this is what I call a successful enterprise. Take us out, Zul!
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
{STR_LeaderFirstName}, listen to me... my consciousness… on my Daemon. I… please… it must not end like this!
Story Piece. Speaker: Zul Nadjian (Syndicate Male)

Zul never told me his neural integration was this far developed. I wonder what other secrets he’s been keeping. Still, disposing of him would be unwise at this point. He may return to be of use for our house.[br/][br/](You cautiously extract Zul's Personality Daemon, a digital backup where his consciousness is stored.)
Story Piece. Speaker: Shae Mara (Syndicate, can be male or female. Female by default.)
